description: Detects scenarios where system auditing (ie: windows event log auditing) is disabled. This may be used in a scenario where an entity would want to bypass local logging to evade detection when windows event logging is enabled and reviewed. Also, it is recommended to turn off "Local Group Policy Object Processing" via GPO, which will make sure that Active Directory GPOs take precedence over local/edited computer policies via something such as "gpedit.msc". Please note, that disabling "Local Group Policy Object Processing" may cause an issue in scenarios of one off specific GPO modifications -- however it is recommended to perform these modifications in Active Directory anyways.

Detects scenarios where system auditing (ie: windows event log auditing) is disabled. This may be used in a scenario where an entity would want to bypass local logging to evade detection when windows event logging is enabled and reviewed. Also, it is recommended to turn off "Local Group Policy Object Processing" via GPO, which will make sure that Active Directory GPOs take precedence over local/edited computer policies via something such as "gpedit.msc". Please note, that disabling "Local Group Policy Object Processing" may cause an issue in scenarios of one off specific GPO modifications -- however it is recommended to perform these modifications in Active Directory anyways.

(winlog.channel:"Security" AND winlog.event_id:"4657" AND winlog.event_data.ObjectName.keyword:\\REGISTRY\\MACHINE\\SYSTEM\\*ControlSet*\\Control\\Lsa* AND winlog.event_data.ObjectValueName:("LmCompatibilityLevel" OR "NtlmMinClientSec" OR "RestrictSendingNTLMTraffic"))

description: Detects when an admin share is mounted using net.exe
query: (process.executable.keyword:(*\\net.exe OR *\\net1.exe) AND process.command_line.keyword:*\ use\ * AND process.command_line.keyword:*\\\\*\*$*)

description: Detects possible bypass EDR and SIEM via abnormal user account name.

Detects successful logon with logon type 9 (NewCredentials) which matches the Overpass the Hash behavior of e.g Mimikatz's sekurlsa::pth module.
query: (winlog.channel:"Security" AND winlog.event_id:"4624" AND winlog.event_data.LogonType:"9" AND winlog.event_data.LogonProcessName:"seclogo" AND winlog.event_data.AuthenticationPackageName:"Negotiate")

description: Detects successful logon with logon type 9 (NewCredentials) which matches the Overpass the Hash behavior of e.g Mimikatz's sekurlsa::pth module.
query: (winlog.channel:"Security" AND winlog.event_id:"4624" AND winlog.event_data.LogonType:"9" AND winlog.event_data.LogonProcessName:"seclogo" AND winlog.event_data.AuthenticationPackageName:"Negotiate")

description: Detects the attack technique pass the hash which is used to move laterally inside the network
query: (winlog.channel:"Security" AND (winlog.event_data.LogonType:"3" AND winlog.event_data.LogonProcessName:"NtLmSsp" AND source.domain:"%Workstations%" AND winlog.ComputerName:"%Workstations%" AND (winlog.event_id:"4624" OR winlog.event_id:"4625")) AND (NOT (winlog.event_data.AccountName:"ANONYMOUS\ LOGON")))

description: Detects the attack technique pass the hash which is used to move laterally inside the network
query: (winlog.channel:"Security" AND (winlog.event_data.LogonType:"3" AND winlog.event_data.LogonProcessName:"NtLmSsp" AND source.domain:"%Workstations%" AND winlog.ComputerName:"%Workstations%" AND (winlog.event_id:"4624" OR winlog.event_id:"4625")) AND (NOT (winlog.event_data.AccountName:"ANONYMOUS\ LOGON")))

description: Detects the attack technique pass the hash which is used to move laterally inside the network
query: (winlog.channel:"Security" AND (winlog.event_id:"4624" AND ((user.id:"S\-1\-0\-0" AND winlog.event_data.LogonType:"3" AND winlog.event_data.LogonProcessName:"NtLmSsp" AND winlog.event_data.KeyLength:"0") OR (winlog.event_data.LogonType:"9" AND winlog.event_data.LogonProcessName:"seclogo"))) AND (NOT (winlog.event_data.AccountName:"ANONYMOUS\ LOGON")))

description: Detects the attack technique pass the hash which is used to move laterally inside the network

description: Detects DCShadow via create new SPN
query: (winlog.channel:"Security" AND ((winlog.event_id:"4742" AND winlog.event_data.ServicePrincipalNames.keyword:*GC\/*) OR (winlog.event_id:"5136" AND winlog.event_data.LDAPDisplayName:"servicePrincipalName" AND Value.keyword:GC\/*)))

description: Detects powershell script installed as a Service

(winlog.channel:"System" AND winlog.event_id:"7045" AND winlog.event_data.ServiceFileName.keyword:(*powershell* OR *pwsh*))
(winlog.channel:"Microsoft\-Windows\-Sysmon\/Operational" AND winlog.event_id:"6" AND winlog.event_data.ServiceFileName.keyword:(*powershell* OR *pwsh*))
(winlog.channel:"Security" AND winlog.event_id:"4697" AND winlog.event_data.ServiceFileName.keyword:(*powershell* OR *pwsh*))

description: Detects Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability aka Zerologon (CVE-2020-1472)

Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.
query:
(winlog.channel:"Microsoft\-Windows\-PowerShell\/Operational" AND winlog.event_id:"4104" AND powershell.file.script_block_text.keyword:*Cert\:\\LocalMachine\\Root* AND (powershell.file.script_block_text.keyword:*Move\-Item* OR powershell.file.script_block_text.keyword:*Import\-Certificate*))
(process.command_line.keyword:*root* AND ((process.executable.keyword:*\\certutil.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:*\-addstore*) OR (process.executable.keyword:*\\CertMgr.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:*\/add*)))

description: Rule to detect an adversary setting OabVirtualDirectory External URL property to a script

description: Look for non-system accounts SMB accessing a file with write (0x2) access mask via administrative share (i.e C$).

description: Adversaries may attempt to enumerate software for a variety of reasons, such as figuring out what security measures are present or if the compromised system has a version of software that is vulnerable.

(process.executable.keyword:*\\reg.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:*query* AND process.command_line.keyword:*\\software\\* AND process.command_line.keyword:*\/v* AND process.command_line.keyword:*svcversion*)

description: Detects interactive console logons to Server Systems

description: This method triggers on rare Kerberos Failure Codes caused by manipulations of Kerberos messages

description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask and object type SAM_DOMAIN

description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask
query: (winlog.channel:"Security" AND ((winlog.event_id:"4656" AND winlog.event_data.ObjectName.keyword:*\\lsass.exe AND winlog.event_data.AccessMask.keyword:(*0x40* OR *0x1400* OR *0x1000* OR *0x100000* OR *0x1410* OR *0x1010* OR *0x1438* OR *0x143a* OR *0x1418* OR *0x1f0fff* OR *0x1f1fff* OR *0x1f2fff* OR *0x1f3fff*)) OR (((winlog.event_id:"4663" AND winlog.event_data.ObjectName.keyword:*\\lsass.exe AND winlog.event_data.AccessList.keyword:(*4484* OR *4416*)) AND (NOT (process.executable.keyword:(*\\wmiprvse.exe OR *\\taskmgr.exe OR *\\procexp64.exe OR *\\procexp.exe OR *\\lsm.exe OR *\\csrss.exe OR *\\wininit.exe OR *\\vmtoolsd.exe OR *\\minionhost.exe OR *\\VsTskMgr.exe OR *\\thor64.exe) AND process.executable.keyword:(C\:\\Windows\\System32\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\SysWow64\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\SysNative\\* OR C\:\\Program\ Files\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\Temp\\asgard2\-agent\\*)))) AND (NOT (process.executable.keyword:(C\:\\Program\ Files*))))))

Detects local user creation on windows servers, which shouldn't happen in an Active Directory environment. Apply this Sigma Use Case on your windows server logs and not on your DC logs.
Detects local user creation on windows servers, which shouldn't happen in an Active Directory environment. Apply this Sigma Use Case on your windows server logs and not on your DC logs.

Detects the loading of drivers via 'SeLoadDriverPrivilege' required to load or unload a device driver. With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode. This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers. If you exclude privileged users/admins and processes, which are allowed to do so, you are maybe left with bad programs trying to load malicious kernel drivers. This will detect Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs) and the usage of Sysinternals and various other tools. So you have to work with a whitelist to find the bad stuff.
query: (winlog.channel:"Security" AND (winlog.event_id:"4673" AND winlog.event_data.PrivilegeList:"SeLoadDriverPrivilege" AND winlog.event_data.Service:"\-") AND (NOT (process.executable.keyword:(*\\Windows\\System32\\Dism.exe OR *\\Windows\\System32\\rundll32.exe OR *\\Windows\\System32\\fltMC.exe OR *\\Windows\\HelpPane.exe OR *\\Windows\\System32\\mmc.exe OR *\\Windows\\System32\\svchost.exe OR *\\Windows\\System32\\wimserv.exe OR *\\procexp64.exe OR *\\procexp.exe OR *\\procmon64.exe OR *\\procmon.exe OR *\\Google\\Chrome\\Application\\chrome.exe))))

Detects password dumper activity by monitoring remote thread creation EventID 8 in combination with the lsass.exe process as TargetImage. The process in field Process is the malicious program. A single execution can lead to hundreds of events.

Detects password dumper activity by monitoring remote thread creation EventID 8 in combination with the lsass.exe process as TargetImage. The process in field Process is the malicious program. A single execution can lead to hundreds of events.

Offensive tradecraft is switching away from using APIs like "CreateRemoteThread", however, this is still largely observed in the wild. This rule aims to detect suspicious processes (those we would not expect to behave in this way like word.exe or outlook.exe) creating remote threads on other processes. It is a generalistic rule, but it should have a low FP ratio due to the selected range of processes.
query: (process.executable.keyword:(*\\bash.exe OR *\\cvtres.exe OR *\\defrag.exe OR *\\dnx.exe OR *\\esentutl.exe OR *\\excel.exe OR *\\expand.exe OR *\\explorer.exe OR *\\find.exe OR *\\findstr.exe OR *\\forfiles.exe OR *\\git.exe OR *\\gpupdate.exe OR *\\hh.exe OR *\\iexplore.exe OR *\\installutil.exe OR *\\lync.exe OR *\\makecab.exe OR *\\mDNSResponder.exe OR *\\monitoringhost.exe OR *\\msbuild.exe OR *\\mshta.exe OR *\\msiexec.exe OR *\\mspaint.exe OR *\\outlook.exe OR *\\ping.exe OR *\\powerpnt.exe OR *\\powershell.exe OR *\\provtool.exe OR *\\python.exe OR *\\regsvr32.exe OR *\\robocopy.exe OR *\\runonce.exe OR *\\sapcimc.exe OR *\\schtasks.exe OR *\\smartscreen.exe OR *\\spoolsv.exe OR *\\tstheme.exe OR *\\userinit.exe OR *\\vssadmin.exe OR *\\vssvc.exe OR *\\w3wp.exe* OR *\\winlogon.exe OR *\\winscp.exe OR *\\wmic.exe OR *\\word.exe OR *\\wscript.exe) AND (NOT (process.executable.keyword:*Visual\ Studio*)))

Detects the creation of the PROCEXP152.sys file in the application-data local temporary folder. This driver is used by Sysinternals Process Explorer but also by KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU) or Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs), which uses KDU.
query: ((file.path.keyword:*\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\* AND file.path.keyword:*PROCEXP152.sys) AND (NOT (process.executable.keyword:(*\\procexp64.exe* OR *\\procexp.exe* OR *\\procmon64.exe* OR *\\procmon.exe*))))

Detects the load of dbghelp/dbgcore DLL (used to make memory dumps) by suspicious processes. Tools like ProcessHacker and some attacker tradecract use MiniDumpWriteDump API found in dbghelp.dll or dbgcore.dll. As an example, SilentTrynity C2 Framework has a module that leverages this API to dump the contents of Lsass.exe and transfer it over the network back to the attacker's machine.
query: (((file.path.keyword:(*\\dbghelp.dll OR *\\dbgcore.dll) AND process.executable.keyword:(*\\msbuild.exe OR *\\cmd.exe OR *\\svchost.exe OR *\\rundll32.exe OR *\\powershell.exe OR *\\word.exe OR *\\excel.exe OR *\\powerpnt.exe OR *\\outlook.exe OR *\\monitoringhost.exe OR *\\wmic.exe OR *\\bash.exe OR *\\wscript.exe OR *\\cscript.exe OR *\\mshta.exe OR *\\regsvr32.exe OR *\\schtasks.exe OR *\\dnx.exe OR *\\regsvcs.exe OR *\\sc.exe OR *\\scriptrunner.exe)) AND (NOT (process.executable.keyword:*Visual\ Studio*))) OR ((file.path.keyword:(*\\dbghelp.dll OR *\\dbgcore.dll) AND winlog.event_data.Signed:"FALSE") AND (NOT (process.executable.keyword:*Visual\ Studio*))))

Winlogon.exe is a Windows component responsible for actions at logon/logoff as well as the secure attention sequence (SAS) triggered by Ctrl-Alt-Delete. Registry entries in HKLM\Software[Wow6432Node]Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ and HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ are used to manage additional helper programs and functionalities that support Winlogon. Malicious modifications to these Registry keys may cause Winlogon to load and execute malicious DLLs and/or executables.

Winlogon.exe is a Windows component responsible for actions at logon/logoff as well as the secure attention sequence (SAS) triggered by Ctrl-Alt-Delete. Registry entries in HKLM\Software[Wow6432Node]Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ and HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ are used to manage additional helper programs and functionalities that support Winlogon. Malicious modifications to these Registry keys may cause Winlogon to load and execute malicious DLLs and/or executables.

description: Detects suspect access to svchost process memory such as that used by Invoke-Phantom to kill the winRM windows event logging service.
Detects suspect access to svchost process memory such as that used by Invoke-Phantom to kill the winRM windows event logging service.

Detects the access to processes by other suspicious processes which have reflectively loaded libraries in their memory space. An example is SilentTrinity C2 behaviour. Generally speaking, when Sysmon EventID 10 cannot reference a stack call to a dll loaded from disk (the standard way), it will display "UNKNOWN" as the module name. Usually this means the stack call points to a module that was reflectively loaded in memory. Adding to this, it is not common to see such few calls in the stack (ntdll.dll --> kernelbase.dll --> unknown) which essentially means that most of the functions required by the process to execute certain routines are already present in memory, not requiring any calls to external libraries. The latter should also be considered suspicious.
query: (((winlog.event_data.CallTrace.keyword:*C\:\\Windows\\SYSTEM32\\ntdll.dll\+* AND winlog.event_data.CallTrace.keyword:*|C\:\\Windows\\System32\\KERNELBASE.dll\+* AND winlog.event_data.CallTrace.keyword:*|UNKNOWN\(* AND winlog.event_data.CallTrace.keyword:*\)*) OR (winlog.event_data.CallTrace.keyword:*UNKNOWN\(* AND winlog.event_data.CallTrace.keyword:*\)|UNKNOWN\(* AND winlog.event_data.CallTrace.keyword:*\))) OR (winlog.event_data.CallTrace.keyword:*UNKNOWN* AND winlog.event_data.GrantedAccess:("0x1F0FFF" OR "0x1F1FFF" OR "0x143A" OR "0x1410" OR "0x1010" OR "0x1F2FFF" OR "0x1F3FFF" OR "0x1FFFFF")))

description: Accesschk is an access and privilege audit tool developed by SysInternal and often being used by attacker to verify if a privilege escalation process succesfull or not
This rule will looks for Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) spawned command line and/or powershell
query: (process.executable.keyword:(*\\cmd.exe OR *\\powershell.exe) AND process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\Windows\\Installer\\* AND process.parent.executable.keyword:*msi* AND process.parent.executable.keyword:(*tmp))

description: This rule will looks for Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) spawned command line and/or powershell that spawned other processes
query: (process.parent.executable.keyword:(*\\cmd.exe OR *\\powershell.exe) AND ParentOfParentImage.keyword:*\\Windows\\Installer\\* AND ParentOfParentImage.keyword:*msi* AND ParentOfParentImage.keyword:(*tmp))

description: This rule will looks for Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) when it tries to install MSI packages with SYSTEM privilege
query: (user.name:"NT\ AUTHORITY\\SYSTEM" AND ((process.executable.keyword:*\\Windows\\Installer\\* AND process.executable.keyword:*msi* AND process.executable.keyword:(*tmp)) OR (process.executable.keyword:(*\\msiexec.exe) AND winlog.event_data.IntegrityLevel:"System")))

(winlog.channel:"System" AND winlog.event_id:"7045" AND winlog.event_data.ServiceName:("SC\ Scheduled\ Scan" OR "UpdatMachine"))
(winlog.channel:"Security" AND winlog.event_id:"4698" AND winlog.event_data.TaskName:("SC\ Scheduled\ Scan" OR "UpdatMachine"))
winlog.event_data.TargetObject.keyword:(*SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\UMe OR *SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\UT)
((process.command_line.keyword:*\\Service.exe* AND process.command_line.keyword:(*i OR *u)) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*\\microsoft\\Taskbar\\autoit3.exe OR process.command_line.keyword:C\:\\wsc.exe*) OR (process.executable.keyword:*\\Windows\\Temp\\DB\\* AND process.executable.keyword:*.exe) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*\\nslookup.exe* AND process.command_line.keyword:*\-q\=TXT* AND process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\Autoit*))

description: Detects a specific process creation patterns as seen used by UNC2452 and provided by Microsoft as Microsoft Defender ATP queries
query: ((((process.command_line.keyword:(*7z.exe\ a\ \-v500m\ \-mx9\ \-r0\ \-p*) OR (process.parent.command_line.keyword:*wscript.exe* AND process.parent.command_line.keyword:*.vbs* AND process.command_line.keyword:*rundll32.exe* AND process.command_line.keyword:*C\:\\Windows* AND process.command_line.keyword:*.dll,Tk_*)) OR (process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\rundll32.exe AND process.parent.command_line.keyword:*C\:\\Windows* AND process.command_line.keyword:*cmd.exe\ \/C\ *)) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*rundll32\ c\:\\windows\\\* AND process.command_line.keyword:*.dll\ *)) OR ((process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\rundll32.exe AND process.executable.keyword:*\\dllhost.exe) AND (NOT (process.command_line:("\ " OR "")))))

description: Detects a specific PowerShell command line pattern used by the UNC2452 actors as mentioned in Microsoft and Symantec reports
query: ((process.command_line.keyword:*Invoke\-WMIMethod\ win32_process\ \-name\ create\ \-argumentlist* AND process.command_line.keyword:*rundll32\ c\:\\windows*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*wmic\ \/node\:* AND process.command_line.keyword:*process\ call\ create\ \"rundll32\ c\:\\windows*))

description: Detects a specific PowerShell command line pattern used by the UNC2452 actors as mentioned in Microsoft and Symantec reports
query: ((process.command_line.keyword:*Invoke\-WMIMethod\ win32_process\ \-name\ create\ \-argumentlist* AND process.command_line.keyword:*rundll32\ c\:\\windows*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*wmic\ \/node\:* AND process.command_line.keyword:*process\ call\ create\ \"rundll32\ c\:\\windows*))

description: Detects attackers using tooling with bad opsec defaults e.g. spawning a sacrificial process to inject a capability into the process without taking into account how the process is normally run, one trivial example of this is using rundll32.exe without arguments as a sacrificial process (default in CS, now highlighted by c2lint), running WerFault without arguments (Kraken - credit am0nsec), and other examples.

Detects attackers using tooling with bad opsec defaults e.g. spawning a sacrificial process to inject a capability into the process without taking into account how the process is normally run, one trivial example of this is using rundll32.exe without arguments as a sacrificial process (default in CS, now highlighted by c2lint), running WerFault without arguments (Kraken - credit am0nsec), and other examples.
Identifies use of the bcdedit command to delete boot configuration data. This tactic is sometimes used as by malware or an attacker as a destructive technique.

description: Detects using register-cimprovider.exe to execute arbitrary dll file.
Detects various anomalies in relation to regsvr32.exe
query: ((process.executable.keyword:*\\regsvr32.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:*\\Temp\\*) OR (process.executable.keyword:*\\regsvr32.exe AND process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\powershell.exe) OR (process.executable.keyword:*\\regsvr32.exe AND process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\cmd.exe) OR (process.executable.keyword:*\\regsvr32.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:*\/i\:* AND process.command_line.keyword:(*http* OR *ftp*) AND process.command_line.keyword:*scrobj.dll) OR (process.executable.keyword:*\\wscript.exe AND process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\regsvr32.exe) OR (process.executable.keyword:*\\EXCEL.EXE AND process.command_line.keyword:*..\\..\\..\\Windows\\System32\\regsvr32.exe\ *))

description: Detects various anomalies in relation to regsvr32.exe
query: ((process.executable.keyword:*\\regsvr32.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:*\\Temp\\*) OR (process.executable.keyword:*\\regsvr32.exe AND process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\powershell.exe) OR (process.executable.keyword:*\\regsvr32.exe AND process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\cmd.exe) OR (process.executable.keyword:*\\regsvr32.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:*\/i\:* AND process.command_line.keyword:(*http* OR *ftp*) AND process.command_line.keyword:*scrobj.dll) OR (process.executable.keyword:*\\wscript.exe AND process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\regsvr32.exe) OR (process.executable.keyword:*\\EXCEL.EXE AND process.command_line.keyword:*..\\..\\..\\Windows\\System32\\regsvr32.exe\ *))

description: Detects a flag anomaly in which regsvr32.exe uses a /i flag without using a /n flag at the same time
Detects a flag anomaly in which regsvr32.exe uses a /i flag without using a /n flag at the same time
Detects a renamed dctask64.exe used for process injection, command execution, process creation with a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation
Detects a renamed dctask64.exe used for process injection, command execution, process creation with a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation
Detects a renamed dctask64.exe used for process injection, command execution, process creation with a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation
Detects a renamed dctask64.exe used for process injection, command execution, process creation with a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation
Detects using Rpcping.exe to send a RPC test connection to the target server (-s) and force the NTLM hash to be sent in the process.
query: ((process.executable.keyword:*\\rpcping.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:(*\-s* OR *\/s*)) AND ((process.command_line.keyword:*\-u* AND process.command_line.keyword:*NTLM*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*\/u* AND process.command_line.keyword:*NTLM*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*\-t* AND process.command_line.keyword:*ncacn_np*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*\/t* AND process.command_line.keyword:*ncacn_np*)))

description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on arguments
query: (process.command_line.keyword:(*javascript\:* OR *.RegisterXLL*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*url.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*OpenURL*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*url.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*OpenURLA*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*url.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*FileProtocolHandler*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*zipfldr.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*RouteTheCall*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*shell32.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*Control_RunDLL*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*shell32.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*ShellExec_RunDLL*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*mshtml.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*PrintHTML*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*advpack.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*LaunchINFSection*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*advpack.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*RegisterOCX*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*ieadvpack.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*LaunchINFSection*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*ieadvpack.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*RegisterOCX*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*ieframe.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*OpenURL*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*shdocvw.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*OpenURL*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*syssetup.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*SetupInfObjectInstallAction'*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*setupapi.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*InstallHinfSection*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*pcwutl.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*LaunchApplication*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*dfshim.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*ShOpenVerbApplication*))

description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on arguments
query: (process.command_line.keyword:(*javascript\:* OR *.RegisterXLL*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*url.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*OpenURL*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*url.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*OpenURLA*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*url.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*FileProtocolHandler*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*zipfldr.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*RouteTheCall*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*shell32.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*Control_RunDLL*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*shell32.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*ShellExec_RunDLL*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*mshtml.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*PrintHTML*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*advpack.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*LaunchINFSection*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*advpack.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*RegisterOCX*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*ieadvpack.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*LaunchINFSection*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*ieadvpack.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*RegisterOCX*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*ieframe.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*OpenURL*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*shdocvw.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*OpenURL*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*syssetup.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*SetupInfObjectInstallAction'*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*setupapi.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*InstallHinfSection*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*pcwutl.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*LaunchApplication*) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*dfshim.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:*ShOpenVerbApplication*))

description: Detects suspicious calls of DLLs in rundll32.dll exports by ordinal
Detects suspicious calls of DLLs in rundll32.dll exports by ordinal

setupapi.dll library provide InstallHinfSection function for processing INF files. INF file may contain instructions allowing to create values in the registry, modify files and install drivers. This technique could be used to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys, run process or use other DLLs chain calls (see references) InstallHinfSection function in setupapi.dll calls runonce.exe executable regardless of actual content of INF file.
Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that includes a *.sys file as seen being used by UNC2452
This rule detects the execution of Run Once task as configured in the registry
query: ((process.executable.keyword:(*\\runonce.exe) OR winlog.event_data.Description:("Run\ Once\ Wrapper")) AND process.command_line.keyword:(*\ \/AlternateShellStartup*))

description: Detects execution of powershell scripts via Runscripthelper.exe
Detects execution of powershell scripts via Runscripthelper.exe
Detects suspicious process run from unusual locations
query: (process.executable.keyword:(*\:\\RECYCLER\\* OR *\:\\SystemVolumeInformation\\*) OR process.executable.keyword:(C\:\\Windows\\Tasks\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\debug\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\fonts\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\help\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\drivers\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\addins\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\cursors\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\system32\\tasks\\*))

description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks in user session
Detects the creation of scheduled tasks in user session
Detects the creation of scheduled tasks that involves a temporary folder and runs only once
query: (process.executable.keyword:*\\schtasks.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:*\ \/create\ * AND process.command_line.keyword:*\ \/sc\ once\ * AND process.command_line.keyword:*\\Temp\\*)

description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript
query: (process.executable.keyword:(*\\wscript.exe OR *\\cscript.exe) AND process.command_line.keyword:(*.jse* OR *.vbe* OR *.js* OR *.vba*))

description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript
query: (process.executable.keyword:(*\\wscript.exe OR *\\cscript.exe) AND process.command_line.keyword:(*.jse* OR *.vbe* OR *.js* OR *.vba*))

description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript
query: (process.executable.keyword:(*\\wscript.exe OR *\\cscript.exe) AND process.command_line.keyword:(*.jse* OR *.vbe* OR *.js* OR *.vba*))

description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications that can  be used to hide services or make them unstopable
query: (process.executable.keyword:(*\\sc.exe) AND process.command_line.keyword:*sdset* AND process.command_line.keyword:*D;;* AND process.command_line.keyword:(*;;;IU* OR *;;;SU* OR *;;;BA* OR *;;;SY* OR *;;;WD*))

description: Detects service path modification to powershell/cmd
query: (process.executable.keyword:*\\sc.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:*config* AND process.command_line.keyword:*binpath* AND process.command_line.keyword:(*powershell* OR *cmd*))

description: Detects service path modification to powershell/cmd
query: (process.executable.keyword:*\\sc.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:*config* AND process.command_line.keyword:*binpath* AND process.command_line.keyword:(*powershell* OR *cmd*))

description: Detects suspicious shell spawn from MSSQL process, this might be sight of RCE or SQL Injection
query: (process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\sqlservr.exe AND process.executable.keyword:(*\\cmd.exe OR *\\sh.exe OR *\\bash.exe OR *\\powershell.exe OR *\\bitsadmin.exe))

description: Detects suspicious shell spawn from MSSQL process, this might be sight of RCE or SQL Injection
query: (process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\sqlservr.exe AND process.executable.keyword:(*\\cmd.exe OR *\\sh.exe OR *\\bash.exe OR *\\powershell.exe OR *\\bitsadmin.exe))

description: Detects actions that clear the local ShimCache and remove forensic evidence
query: (process.command_line.keyword:*rundll32* AND ((process.command_line.keyword:*apphelp.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:(*ShimFlushCache* OR *#250*)) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*kernel32.dll* AND process.command_line.keyword:(*BaseFlushAppcompatCache* OR *#46*))))

description: Detects process dump via legitimate sqldumper.exe binary
Detects Possible Squirrel Packages Manager as Lolbin
Detects a suspicious svchost process start
query: ((process.executable.keyword:*\\svchost.exe AND (NOT (process.parent.executable.keyword:(*\\services.exe OR *\\MsMpEng.exe OR *\\Mrt.exe OR *\\rpcnet.exe OR *\\svchost.exe)))) AND (NOT (NOT _exists_:process.parent.executable)))

description: Detects a suspicious svchost process start
query: ((process.executable.keyword:*\\svchost.exe AND (NOT (process.parent.executable.keyword:(*\\services.exe OR *\\MsMpEng.exe OR *\\Mrt.exe OR *\\rpcnet.exe OR *\\svchost.exe)))) AND (NOT (NOT _exists_:process.parent.executable)))

description: It is extremely abnormal for svchost.exe to spawn without any CLI arguments and is normally observed when a malicious process spawns the process and injects code into the process memory space.

Detects Access to Domain Group Policies stored in SYSVOL

Detects the creation of a process from Windows task manager

Detects a tscon.exe start as LOCAL SYSTEM
Detects a suspicious RDP session redirect using tscon.exe
Detects a suspicious RDP session redirect using tscon.exe
Detects a suspicious RDP session redirect using tscon.exe
Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell

This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqlps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the MSSQL Server. Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.

Windows Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF) framework allows you to run automation by executing tests files written on different languages (C, C#, Microsoft COM Scripting interfaces). Adversaries may execute malicious code (such as WSC file with VBScript, dll and so on) directly by running te.exe

There is an option for a MS VS Just-In-Time Debugger "vsjitdebugger.exe" to launch specified executable and attach a debugger. This option may be used adversaries to execute malicious code by signed verified binary. The debugger is installed alongside with Microsoft Visual Studio package.

Detect VBoxDrvInst.exe run whith parameters allowing processing INF file. This allows to create values in the registry and install drivers. For example one could use this technique to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys
Detects commands that temporarily turn off Volume Snapshots
query: (process.command_line.keyword:*reg* AND process.command_line.keyword:*\ add\ * AND process.command_line.keyword:*\\Services\\VSS\\Diag* AND process.command_line.keyword:*\/d\ Disabled*)

description: Detects the execution of whoami, which is often used by attackers after exloitation / privilege escalation but rarely used by administrators
Detects execution of attacker-controlled WsmPty.xsl or WsmTxt.xsl via winrm.vbs and copied cscript.exe (can be renamed)
query:
(process.command_line.keyword:*winrm* AND process.command_line.keyword:(*format\:pretty* OR *format\:\"pretty\"* OR *format\:\"text\"* OR *format\:text*) AND (NOT (process.executable.keyword:(C\:\\Windows\\System32\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\*))))
(file.path.keyword:(*WsmPty.xsl OR *WsmTxt.xsl) AND (NOT (file.path.keyword:(C\:\\Windows\\System32\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\*))))

description: Detects an attempt to execude code or create service on remote host via winrm.vbs.
query: (process.executable.keyword:*\\cscript.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:*winrm* AND process.command_line.keyword:*invoke\ Create\ wmicimv2\/Win32_* AND process.command_line.keyword:*\-r\:http*)

description: Detects WMI executing rundll32
Detects deinstallation of security products using WMIC utility
query: (process.command_line.keyword:*wmic* AND process.command_line.keyword:*product\ where\ name\=* AND process.command_line.keyword:*call\ uninstall* AND process.command_line.keyword:*\/nointeractive* AND process.command_line.keyword:(*Antivirus* OR *Endpoint\ Security* OR *Endpoint\ Detection* OR *Crowdstrike\ Sensor* OR *Windows\ Defender* OR *VirusScan* OR *Threat\ Protection* OR *Endpoint\ Sensor*))

description: Detects WMI executing suspicious commands
query: (process.executable.keyword:*\\wmic.exe AND ((process.command_line.keyword:*\/NODE\:* AND process.command_line.keyword:*process* AND process.command_line.keyword:*call* AND process.command_line.keyword:*create\ *) OR (process.command_line.keyword:*\ path\ * AND process.command_line.keyword:(*AntiVirus* OR *Firewall*) AND process.command_line.keyword:*Product* AND process.command_line.keyword:*\ get\ *)))

description: Detects Possible usage of Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) binary as a LOLBIN
Detects Possible usage of Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) binary as a LOLBIN

Detects code execution via the Windows Update client (wuauclt)

Detects a Windows program executable started in a suspicious folder
query: (process.executable.keyword:(*\\svchost.exe OR *\\rundll32.exe OR *\\services.exe OR *\\powershell.exe OR *\\regsvr32.exe OR *\\spoolsv.exe OR *\\lsass.exe OR *\\smss.exe OR *\\csrss.exe OR *\\conhost.exe OR *\\wininit.exe OR *\\lsm.exe OR *\\winlogon.exe OR *\\explorer.exe OR *\\taskhost.exe OR *\\Taskmgr.exe OR *\\sihost.exe OR *\\RuntimeBroker.exe OR *\\smartscreen.exe OR *\\dllhost.exe OR *\\audiodg.exe OR *\\wlanext.exe) AND (NOT (process.executable.keyword:(C\:\\Windows\\System32\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\system32\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\SysWow64\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\winsxs\\* OR C\:\\Windows\\WinSxS\\* OR C\:\\avast\!\ sandbox*) OR process.executable.keyword:*\\SystemRoot\\System32\\* OR process.executable:"C\:\\Windows\\explorer.exe")))

description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunneling techniques

query: (process.command_line.keyword:(*echo\ * OR *copy\ * OR *type\ * OR *file\ createnew*) AND process.command_line.keyword:(*\ C\:\\Windows\\System32\\Tasks\\* OR *\ C\:\\Windows\\SysWow64\\Tasks\\*))

winlog.event_data.TargetObject.keyword:(*\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\ NT\\CurrentVersion\\Image\ File\ Execution\ Options\\sethc.exe\\Debugger OR *\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\ NT\\CurrentVersion\\Image\ File\ Execution\ Options\\utilman.exe\\Debugger OR *\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\ NT\\CurrentVersion\\Image\ File\ Execution\ Options\\osk.exe\\Debugger OR *\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\ NT\\CurrentVersion\\Image\ File\ Execution\ Options\\Magnify.exe\\Debugger OR *\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\ NT\\CurrentVersion\\Image\ File\ Execution\ Options\\Narrator.exe\\Debugger OR *\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\ NT\\CurrentVersion\\Image\ File\ Execution\ Options\\DisplaySwitch.exe\\Debugger)
(process.parent.executable.keyword:*\\winlogon.exe AND process.executable.keyword:*\\cmd.exe AND process.command_line.keyword:(*sethc.exe* OR *utilman.exe* OR *osk.exe* OR *Magnify.exe* OR *Narrator.exe* OR *DisplaySwitch.exe*))

description: Detects installation of NalDrv or PROCEXP152 services via registry-keys to non-system32 folders. Both services are used in the tool Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs), which uses KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU)
query: ((winlog.event_data.TargetObject:("HKLM\\System\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\NalDrv\\ImagePath" OR "HKLM\\System\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\PROCEXP152\\ImagePath") AND (NOT (process.executable.keyword:(*\\procexp64.exe OR *\\procexp.exe OR *\\procmon64.exe OR *\\procmon.exe)))) AND (NOT (winlog.event_data.Details.keyword:(*\\WINDOWS\\system32\\Drivers\\PROCEXP152.SYS*))))
